title: Protocol art: conceptual foundations and historical examples

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Wed, 17 Sept 25\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Protocol Art Definition and Core Concepts\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Protocol art: structured set of rules/guidelines informing creative production\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Protocol artist creates rules, third parties execute/instantiate them\
◦ Each instantiation creates novel artwork embodying both artists creativity\
◦ Requires discretionary creative input from instantiators (not just execution)\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Key shift from autographic works (artists hands) to allographic works (others can instantiate)\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Desacralizes the unique genius artist figure\
◦ Artist becomes orchestrator enabling others creative contributions\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Protocol as medium vs. protocol as tool\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Medium: protocol itself has artistic saliency, becomes machine that makes art\
◦ Tool: using existing protocols to create traditional art pieces\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Historical Examples and Art Movement Context\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Early manifestations (1923 onwards):\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ László Moholy-Nagy: telephone pictures with intentionally ambiguous instructions to sign makers\
◦ Sol LeWitt: wall drawings with precise/open-ended descriptions for museum staff\
◦ Claude Rutault: wall paintings matching exact wall color\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Literary and performance protocols:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Yoko Ono, Alison Knowles: instruction-based performances\
◦ Oulipo movement: constraint-based literary works promoting creativity through limitations\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Art as primitives approach:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Altos Bülsar: distinctive tiles for others to create mosaics\
◦ Felix Gonzalez-Torres: blue candies with museum replenishment decisions\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Framework/canvas examples:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ John Cage: 433" - silence container filled by audience sounds\
◦ Marina Abramović : body as canvas for public interaction\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Contemporary Technology and Digital Platforms\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Digital technology expanding protocol art possibilities:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Increased design space, reach, scope, and speed\
◦ Multi-user interactivity enabling synchronous/asynchronous collaboration\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Examples of digital protocol art:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Million Dollar Homepage, Reddit Place: coordinated pixel manipulation\
◦ Online collaborative drawing platforms (infinite movies cocreated)\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Generative AI as protocol medium (not just tool):\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Holly+ (Oly Plus): voice model available for others with royalty distribution\
◦ Helena Sarin: trained personal model on own work, made available to others\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Blockchain as medium vs. transaction layer:\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Beyond NFT sales (just transaction layer)\
◦ Smart contracts as programmable art protocols\
◦ Examples: Operators Human Unreadable choreography, Plantoid autonomous reproduction\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Taxonomy and Classification System\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Three primary axes for categorizing protocol art:\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Atomic to Systemic\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Atomic: precise, simple rules for specific pieces\
◦ Systemic: complex, open-ended primitives creating ecosystems\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Strict to Fluid\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Strict: rigid guidelines with low tolerance for deviation\
◦ Fluid: ambiguous, open-to-interpretation guidelines\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Technical to Social\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Technical: encoded in technology (code, smart contracts)\
◦ Social: based on norms and agreements\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Governance and Control Dynamics\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Protocol artists lose control once protocol is released\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Cannot fully control instantiation without becoming technical execution\
◦ Resulting artworks always indeterminate while following pattern integrity\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Asynchronous collaboration enables permissionless creation\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ No required interaction between protocol artist and instantiator\
◦ Creates new form of dialogue without direct communication\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Risk of protocol genericization\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Popular protocols may lose trademark-like association with creator\
◦ Artists must actively maintain authorship claims\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Case Studies for Tomorrows Deep Dive\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Holly+ (Oly Plus): AI voice model protocol\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Generative AI-native approach\
◦ Royalty distribution system for voice usage\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Plantoid: blockchain-based autonomous reproduction\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Accumulates cryptocurrency to hire artists for new instances\
◦ Smart contract governance for reproduction decisions\
◦ Artists must follow genetic properties while adding creative interpretation\

d
deftab720tightenfactor0

Next Steps\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Homework assignments:\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Identify and analyze one protocol artwork\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Describe the actual protocol (not finite piece)\
◦ Show how different instantiations diverge but maintain pattern\
◦ Apply taxonomy (atomic/systemic, strict/fluid, technical/social)\

ddeftab720-720tightenfactor0
• Research Holly+ and Plantoid case studies for tomorrows analysis\

ddeftab720-1440tightenfactor0
◦ Focus on governance, economic models, legal and ethical implications\
◦ Tomorrows session covers consequences and implications of protocol art
